main event: On November 7, 1957, a bright orange object, 15 feet in diameter, and traveling at an estimated 6,000 mph was observed visually and on ground radar 5 miles east of Moisant, LA.
interesting points: The object was seen visually and on ground radar simultaneously, providing multiple forms of evidence.
The object's velocity was estimated at an incredibly fast 6,000 mph.
It was observed for a relatively short period of 5 minutes, consistent with a probable meteor sighting.
The radar aspect of the object was consistent with a meteor, further supporting the conclusion.
The weather at the time was described as high, thin, and scattered, with the moon setting at 7:52 PM, providing additional environmental context.
sighted object: bright orange object, 15 feet in diameter, traveling at 6,000 mph
